content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting problem and a good addition to fastest/shortest! Simple to hard code and able to make shorter & prettier solutions.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice little problem. Fun to perform

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Well-designed problem. One can solve this problem with brute force within a reasonable amount of time, but can also think a little bit to obtain a faster/shorter solution.

Ans=w*(w+1)*h*(h+1)/4
This is widely known, and it is most likely that in fastest mode, 'knowing the answer' will determine the result of the clash, rather than math skill/programming skill.
Widely known doesn't mean anyone can find it in 10 sec. I think no clash of code is too simple, and people who doesn't know the "short answer" can still have fun coding a solution.
